  655    "__STYX_TYPE__": typing.Literal["threshold"],
  656    "threshold": str,
  657})
  658C3dTileParameters = typing.TypedDict('C3dTileParameters', {
  659    "__STYX_TYPE__": typing.Literal["tile"],
  660    "tile": str,
  661})
  662C3dTrimParameters = typing.TypedDict('C3dTrimParameters', {
  663    "__STYX_TYPE__": typing.Literal["trim"],
  664    "trim": str,
  665})
  666C3dTrimToSizeParameters = typing.TypedDict('C3dTrimToSizeParameters', {
  667    "__STYX_TYPE__": typing.Literal["trim_to_size"],
  668    "trim_to_size": str,
  669})
  670C3dTypeParameters = typing.TypedDict('C3dTypeParameters', {
  671    "__STYX_TYPE__": typing.Literal["type"],
  672    "type": str,
  673})
  674C3dVerboseParameters = typing.TypedDict('C3dVerboseParameters', {
  675    "__STYX_TYPE__": typing.Literal["verbose"],
  676    "verbose": str,
  677})
  678C3dNoverboseParameters = typing.TypedDict('C3dNoverboseParameters', {
  679    "__STYX_TYPE__": typing.Literal["noverbose"],
  680    "noverbose": str,
  681})
  682C3dVersionParameters = typing.TypedDict('C3dVersionParameters', {
  683    "__STYX_TYPE__": typing.Literal["version"],
  684    "version": str,
  685})
  686C3dVoteParameters = typing.TypedDict('C3dVoteParameters', {
  687    "__STYX_TYPE__": typing.Literal["vote"],
  688    "vote": str,
  689})
  690C3dVoteMrfParameters = typing.TypedDict('C3dVoteMrfParameters', {
  691    "__STYX_TYPE__": typing.Literal["vote_mrf"],
  692    "vote_mrf": str,
  693})
  694C3dVoteLabelParameters = typing.TypedDict('C3dVoteLabelParameters', {
  695    "__STYX_TYPE__": typing.Literal["vote_label"],
  696    "vote_label": str,
  697})
  698C3dVoxelSumParameters = typing.TypedDict('C3dVoxelSumParameters', {
  699    "__STYX_TYPE__": typing.Literal["voxel_sum"],
  700    "voxel_sum": str,
  701})
  702C3dVoxelIntegralParameters = typing.TypedDict('C3dVoxelIntegralParameters', {
  703    "__STYX_TYPE__": typing.Literal["voxel_integral"],
  704    "voxel_integral": str,
  705})
  706C3dVoxelwiseRegressionParameters = typing.TypedDict('C3dVoxelwiseRegressionParameters', {
  707    "__STYX_TYPE__": typing.Literal["voxelwise_regression"],
  708    "voxelwise_regression": str,
  709})
  710C3dWarpParameters = typing.TypedDict('C3dWarpParameters', {
  711    "__STYX_TYPE__": typing.Literal["warp"],
  712    "warp": str,
  713})
  714C3dWarpLabelParameters = typing.TypedDict('C3dWarpLabelParameters', {
  715    "__STYX_TYPE__": typing.Literal["warp_label"],
  716    "warp_label": str,
  717})
  718C3dWrapParameters = typing.TypedDict('C3dWrapParameters', {
  719    "__STYX_TYPE__": typing.Literal["wrap"],
  720    "wrap": str,
  721})
  722C3dWeightedSumParameters = typing.TypedDict('C3dWeightedSumParameters', {
  723    "__STYX_TYPE__": typing.Literal["weighted_sum"],
  724    "weighted_sum": str,
  725})
  726C3dWeightedSumVoxelwiseParameters = typing.TypedDict('C3dWeightedSumVoxelwiseParameters', {
  727    "__STYX_TYPE__": typing.Literal["weighted_sum_voxelwise"],
  728    "weighted_sum_voxelwise": str,
  729})
  730C3dParameters = typing.TypedDict('C3dParameters', {
  731    "__STYX_TYPE__": typing.Literal["c3d"],
  732    "input": list[InputPathType],
  733    "operations": list[typing.Union[C3dAccumParameters, C3dAcosParameters, C3dAddParameters, C3dAlignLandmarksParameters, C3dAnisotropicDiffusionParameters, C3dAntialiasParameters, C3dSetParameters, C3dAsinParameters, C3dAtan2Parameters, C3dBackgroundParameters, C3dN4BiasCorrectionParameters, C3dBinarizeParameters, C3dCannyParameters, C3dCeilParameters, C3dCentroidParameters, C3dCentroidMarkParameters, C3dConnectedComponentsParameters, C3dClearParameters, C3dClipParameters, C3dColorMapParameters, C3dCompressParameters, C3dNoCompressParameters, C3dConvParameters, C3dCoordinateMapVoxelParameters, C3dCoordinateMapPhysicalParameters, C3dCopyTransformParameters, C3dCosParameters, C3dCreateParameters, C3dDicomSeriesListParameters, C3dDicomSeriesReadParameters, C3dDilateParameters, C3dDivideParameters, C3dDuplicateParameters, C3dEndaccumParameters, C3dEndforParameters, C3dErodeParameters, C3dErfParameters, C3dExpParameters, C3dExportPatchesParameters, C3dExportPatchesAugParameters, C3dExtrudeSegParameters, C3dFillBackgroundWithNoiseParameters, C3dFftParameters, C3dFlipParameters, C3dFloorParameters, C3dForeachParameters, C3dForeachCompParameters, C3dGlmParameters, C3dGradientParameters, C3dHelpParameters, C3dHolefillParameters, C3dHessianEigenvaluesParameters, C3dHessianObjectnessParameters, C3dHistogramMatchParameters, C3dInfoParameters, C3dInfoFullParameters, C3dInsertParameters, C3dInterpolationParameters, C3dIterationsParameters, C3dLabelOverlapParameters, C3dLabelStatisticsParameters, C3dLandmarksToSpheresParameters, C3dLaplacianParameters, C3dLevelsetParameters, C3dLevelsetCurvatureParameters, C3dLevelsetAdvectionParameters, C3dLogParameters, C3dLog10Parameters, C3dManualParameters, C3dMatchBoundingBoxParameters, C3dMaximumParameters, C3dMulticomponentSplitParameters, C3dMeanParameters, C3dMedianFilterParameters, C3dMergeParameters, C3dMeanFilterParameters, C3dMutualInfoParameters, C3dMinimumParameters, C3dMixtureModelParameters, C3dMomentsParameters, C3dMattesMutualInfoParameters, C3dMeanSquareParameters, C3dMultiplyParameters, C3dNormalizedCrossCorrelationParameters, C3dNormalizedCorrelationParameters, C3dNormalizedMutualInfoParameters, C3dNoiseGaussianParameters, C3dNoisePoissonParameters, C3dNoiseSpeckleParameters, C3dNoiseSaltPepperParameters, C3dNoMulticomponentSplitParameters, C3dNormalizeLocalWindowParameters, C3dNormpdfParameters, C3dNoroundParameters, C3dNospmParameters, C3dOutputParameters, C3dOutputMulticomponentParameters, C3dOutputMultipleMulticomponentParameters, C3dOrientParameters, C3dOutputMultipleParameters, C3dOrient1Parameters, C3dOriginParameters, C3dOriginVoxelParameters, C3dOriginVoxelCoordParameters, C3dOverlapParameters, C3dOverlayLabelImageParameters, C3dPadParameters, C3dPadToParameters, C3dPcaParameters, C3dPercentIntensityModeParameters, C3dPixelParameters, C3dPopParameters, C3dPopasParameters, C3dProbeParameters, C3dPushParameters, C3dRankParameters, C3dReciprocalParameters, C3dRegionParameters, C3dReorderParameters, C3dRetainLabelsParameters, C3dRfApplyParameters, C3dRfTrainParameters, C3dRfParamPatchParameters, C3dRfParamUsexyzParameters, C3dRfParamNousexyzParameters, C3dRfParamNtreesParameters, C3dRfParamTreedepthParameters, C3dSetSformParameters, C3dReplaceParameters, C3dResampleParameters, C3dResampleIsoParameters, C3dResampleMmParameters, C3dResliceItkParameters, C3dResliceMatrixParameters, C3dResliceIdentityParameters, C3dRgb2hsvParameters, C3dRmsParameters, C3dRoundParameters, C3dScaleParameters, C3dSetSform1Parameters, C3dSinParameters, C3dSliceParameters, C3dSliceAllParameters, C3dSharpenParameters, C3dShiftParameters, C3dSignedDistanceTransformParameters, C3dSmoothParameters, C3dSmoothFastParameters, C3dSpacingParameters, C3dSplitParameters, C3dSqrtParameters, C3dStapleParameters, C3dStructureTensorEigenvaluesParameters, C3dSpmParameters, C3dSubtractParameters, C3dSupervoxelParameters, C3dStretchParameters, C3dSwapdimParameters, C3dTestImageParameters, C3dTestProbeParameters, C3dThresholdParameters, C3dTileParameters, C3dTrimParameters, C3dTrimToSizeParameters, C3dTypeParameters, C3dVerboseParameters, C3dNoverboseParameters, C3dVersionParameters, C3dVoteParameters, C3dVoteMrfParameters, C3dVoteLabelParameters, C3dVoxelSumParameters, C3dVoxelIntegralParameters, C3dVoxelwiseRegressionParameters, C3dWarpParameters, C3dWarpLabelParameters, C3dWrapParameters, C3dWeightedSumParameters, C3dWeightedSumVoxelwiseParameters]],
  734    "output": str,
  735})
  736
  737
  738def dyn_cargs(
  739    t: str,
  740) -> typing.Any:
  741    """
  742    Get build cargs function by command type.
  743    
  744    Args:
  745        t: Command type.
  746    Returns:
  747        Build cargs function.
  748    """
  749    return {
  750        "c3d": c3d_cargs,
  751        "accum": c3d_accum_cargs,
  752        "acos": c3d_acos_cargs,
  753        "add": c3d_add_cargs,
  754        "align_landmarks": c3d_align_landmarks_cargs,
  755        "anisotropic_diffusion": c3d_anisotropic_diffusion_cargs,
  756        "antialias": c3d_antialias_cargs,
  757        "set": c3d_set_cargs,
  758        "asin": c3d_asin_cargs,
  759        "atan2": c3d_atan2_cargs,
  760        "background": c3d_background_cargs,
  761        "n4_bias_correction": c3d_n4_bias_correction_cargs,
  762        "binarize": c3d_binarize_cargs,
  763        "canny": c3d_canny_cargs,
  764        "ceil": c3d_ceil_cargs,
  765        "centroid": c3d_centroid_cargs,
  766        "centroid_mark": c3d_centroid_mark_cargs,
  767        "connected_components": c3d_connected_components_cargs,
  768        "clear": c3d_clear_cargs,
  769        "clip": c3d_clip_cargs,
  770        "color_map": c3d_color_map_cargs,
  771        "compress": c3d_compress_cargs,
  772        "no_compress": c3d_no_compress_cargs,
  773        "conv": c3d_conv_cargs,
  774        "coordinate_map_voxel": c3d_coordinate_map_voxel_cargs,
  775        "coordinate_map_physical": c3d_coordinate_map_physical_cargs,
  776        "copy_transform": c3d_copy_transform_cargs,
  777        "cos": c3d_cos_cargs,
  778        "create": c3d_create_cargs,
  779        "dicom_series_list": c3d_dicom_series_list_cargs,
  780        "dicom_series_read": c3d_dicom_series_read_cargs,
  781        "dilate": c3d_dilate_cargs,
  782        "divide": c3d_divide_cargs,
  783        "duplicate": c3d_duplicate_cargs,
  784        "endaccum": c3d_endaccum_cargs,
  785        "endfor": c3d_endfor_cargs,
  786        "erode": c3d_erode_cargs,
  787        "erf": c3d_erf_cargs,
  788        "exp": c3d_exp_cargs,
  789        "export_patches": c3d_export_patches_cargs,
  790        "export_patches_aug": c3d_export_patches_aug_cargs,
  791        "extrude_seg": c3d_extrude_seg_cargs,
  792        "fill_background_with_noise": c3d_fill_background_with_noise_cargs,
  793        "fft": c3d_fft_cargs,
  794        "flip": c3d_flip_cargs,
  795        "floor": c3d_floor_cargs,
  796        "foreach": c3d_foreach_cargs,
  797        "foreach_comp": c3d_foreach_comp_cargs,
  798        "glm": c3d_glm_cargs,
  799        "gradient": c3d_gradient_cargs,
  800        "_help": c3d__help_cargs,
  801        "holefill": c3d_holefill_cargs,
  802        "hessian_eigenvalues": c3d_hessian_eigenvalues_cargs,
  803        "hessian_objectness": c3d_hessian_objectness_cargs,
  804        "histogram_match": c3d_histogram_match_cargs,
  805        "info": c3d_info_cargs,

  808        "interpolation": c3d_interpolation_cargs,

  843        "normpdf": c3d_normpdf_cargs,
  844        "noround": c3d_noround_cargs,
  845        "nospm": c3d_nospm_cargs,
  846        "output": c3d_output_cargs,
  847        "output_multicomponent": c3d_output_multicomponent_cargs,

  880        "resample": c3d_resample_cargs,
  881        "resample_iso": c3d_resample_iso_cargs,
  882        "resample_mm": c3d_resample_mm_cargs,

  884        "reslice_matrix": c3d_reslice_matrix_cargs,
  885        "reslice_identity": c3d_reslice_identity_cargs,
  886        "rgb2hsv": c3d_rgb2hsv_cargs,
  887        "rms": c3d_rms_cargs,
  888        "round": c3d_round_cargs,
  889        "scale": c3d_scale_cargs,
  890        "set_sform_1": c3d_set_sform_1_cargs,
  891        "sin": c3d_sin_cargs,
  892        "slice": c3d_slice_cargs,
  893        "slice_all": c3d_slice_all_cargs,
  894        "sharpen": c3d_sharpen_cargs,
  895        "shift": c3d_shift_cargs,
  896        "signed_distance_transform": c3d_signed_distance_transform_cargs,
  897        "smooth": c3d_smooth_cargs,
  898        "smooth_fast": c3d_smooth_fast_cargs,
  899        "spacing": c3d_spacing_cargs,
  900        "split": c3d_split_cargs,
  901        "sqrt": c3d_sqrt_cargs,
  902        "staple": c3d_staple_cargs,
  903        "structure_tensor_eigenvalues": c3d_structure_tensor_eigenvalues_cargs,
  904        "spm": c3d_spm_cargs,
  905        "subtract": c3d_subtract_cargs,
  906        "supervoxel": c3d_supervoxel_cargs,
  907        "stretch": c3d_stretch_cargs,
  908        "swapdim": c3d_swapdim_cargs,
  909        "test_image": c3d_test_image_cargs,
  910        "test_probe": c3d_test_probe_cargs,
  911        "threshold": c3d_threshold_cargs,
  912        "tile": c3d_tile_cargs,
  913        "trim": c3d_trim_cargs,
  914        "trim_to_size": c3d_trim_to_size_cargs,
  915        "type": c3d_type_cargs,
  916        "verbose": c3d_verbose_cargs,
  917        "noverbose": c3d_noverbose_cargs,
  918        "version": c3d_version_cargs,
  919        "vote": c3d_vote_cargs,
  920        "vote_mrf": c3d_vote_mrf_cargs,
  921        "vote_label": c3d_vote_label_cargs,
  922        "voxel_sum": c3d_voxel_sum_cargs,
  923        "voxel_integral": c3d_voxel_integral_cargs,
  924        "voxelwise_regression": c3d_voxelwise_regression_cargs,
  925        "warp": c3d_warp_cargs,
  926        "warp_label": c3d_warp_label_cargs,
  927        "wrap": c3d_wrap_cargs,
  928        "weighted_sum": c3d_weighted_sum_cargs,
  929        "weighted_sum_voxelwise": c3d_weighted_sum_voxelwise_cargs,
  930    }.get(t)
  931
  932
  933def dyn_outputs(
  934    t: str,
  935) -> typing.Any:
  936    """
  937    Get build outputs function by command type.
  938    
  939    Args:
  940        t: Command type.
  941    Returns:
  942        Build outputs function.
  943    """
  944    return {
  945        "c3d": c3d_outputs,
  946        "output": c3d_output_outputs,
  947    }.get(t)
  948
  949
  950def c3d_accum_params(
  951    accum: str,
  952) -> C3dAccumParameters:
  953    """
  954    Build parameters.
  955    
  956    Args:
  957        accum: -accum, -endaccum: Accumulate operations over all images\
  958            \
  959            Syntax: `-accum command-list -endaccum`\
  960            \
  961            Apply a binary operation (such as addition or multiplication) to\
  962            all the images on the stack in a cumulative fashion. The command(s)\
  963            will be applied to the last and second-to-last images on the stack,\
  964            then to the result of this operation and the third-to-last image on\
  965            the stack and so on. Below is the example of using the command to\
  966            add multiple images.\
  967            \
  968            c3d image*.nii -accum -add -endaccum -o sum.nii.
  969    Returns:
  970        Parameter dictionary
  971    """
  972    params = {
  973        "__STYXTYPE__": "accum",
  974        "accum": accum,
  975    }
  976    return params
  977
  978
  979def c3d_accum_cargs(
  980    params: C3dAccumParameters,
  981    execution: Execution,
  982) -> list[str]:
  983    """
  984    Build command-line arguments from parameters.
  985    
  986    Args:
  987        params: The parameters.
  988        execution: The execution object for resolving input paths.
  989    Returns:
  990        Command-line arguments.
  991    """
  992    cargs = []
  993    cargs.extend([
  994        "-accum",
  995        params.get("accum")
  996    ])
  997    return cargs
  998
  999
 1000def c3d_acos_params(
 1001    acos: str,
 1002) -> C3dAcosParameters:
 1003    """
 1004    Build parameters.
 1005    
 1006    Args:
 1007        acos: No description found.
 1008    Returns:
 1009        Parameter dictionary
 1010    """
 1011    params = {
 1012        "__STYXTYPE__": "acos",
 1013        "acos": acos,
 1014    }
 1015    return params
 1016
 1017
 1018def c3d_acos_cargs(
 1019    params: C3dAcosParameters,
 1020    execution: Execution,
 1021) -> list[str]:
 1022    """
 1023    Build command-line arguments from parameters.
 1024    
 1025    Args:
 1026        params: The parameters.
 1027        execution: The execution object for resolving input paths.
 1028    Returns:
 1029        Command-line arguments.
 1030    """
 1031    cargs = []
 1032    cargs.extend([
 1033        "-acos",
 1034        params.get("acos")
 1035    ])
 1036    return cargs
 1037
 1038
 1039def c3d_add_params(
 1040    add: str,
 1041) -> C3dAddParameters:
 1042    """
 1043    Build parameters.
 1044    
 1045    Args:
 1046        add: -add: Voxelwise image addition\
 1047            \
 1048            Syntax: `-add`\
 1049            \
 1050            Adds the last two images on the stack, and places the sum at the\
 1051            end of the stack.\
 1052            \
 1053            # Add two images: x = a + b\
 1054            c3d a.img b.img -add -o x.img\
 1055            \
 1056            # Add three images, x = (a + b) + c in the first example, x = a +\
 1057            (b + c) in the second\
 1058            c3d a.img b.img -add c.img -add -o x.img\
 1059            c3d a.img b.img c.img -add -add -o x.img\
 1060            \
 1061            # Subtract two images, using -scale command: x = a - b\
 1062            c3d a.img b.img -scale -1 -add -o x.img.
 1063    Returns:
 1064        Parameter dictionary
 1065    """
 1066    params = {
 1067        "__STYXTYPE__": "add",
 1068        "add": add,
 1069    }
 1070    return params
 1071
 1072
 1073def c3d_add_cargs(
 1074    params: C3dAddParameters,
 1075    execution: Execution,
 1076) -> list[str]:
 1077    """
 1078    Build command-line arguments from parameters.
 1079    
 1080    Args:
 1081        params: The parameters.
 1082        execution: The execution object for resolving input paths.
 1083    Returns:
 1084        Command-line arguments.
 1085    """
 1086    cargs = []
 1087    cargs.extend([
 1088        "-add",
 1089        params.get("add")
 1090    ])
 1091    return cargs
 1092
 1093
 1094def c3d_align_landmarks_params(
 1095    align_landmarks: str,
 1096) -> C3dAlignLandmarksParameters:
 1097    """
 1098    Build parameters.
 1099    
 1100    Args:
 1101        align_landmarks: -alm, -align-landmarks: Align images based on landmark\
 1102            matching\
 1103            \
 1104            Syntax: `-alm dof outfile`\
 1105            \
 1106            Performs rigid or affine alignment between to sets of landmark\
 1107            images. A landmark image is an image where for every intensity\
 1108            value, the centroid of all voxels with that intensity represents a\
 1109            landmark. Landmarks can be created using the paintbrush tool in\
 1110            ITK-SNAP (they can be spheres, cubes, etc). The first image on the\
 1111            stack is the target/fixed/reference image, and the second is the\
 1112            moving image. The parameters are the degrees of freedom, which is a\
 1113            number (6 for rigid, 7 for rigid+scale, 12 for affine) and the\
 1114            output matrix file. In this example, we have images **fixed.nii*\
 1115            and **moving.nii** with corresponding landmark images. We use\
 1116            landmarks to align the moving image to the fixed:\
 1117            \
 1118            c3d fixed_landmarks.nii moving_landmarks.nii -alm 6 rigid.mat\
 1119            c3d fixed.nii moving.nii -reslice-matrix rigid.mat -o\
 1120            moving_resliced_to_fixed.nii.
 1121    Returns:
 1122        Parameter dictionary
 1123    """
 1124    params = {
 1125        "__STYXTYPE__": "align_landmarks",
 1126        "align_landmarks": align_landmarks,
 1127    }
 1128    return params
 1129
 1130
 1131def c3d_align_landmarks_cargs(
 1132    params: C3dAlignLandmarksParameters,
 1133    execution: Execution,
 1134) -> list[str]:
 1135    """
 1136    Build command-line arguments from parameters.
 1137    
 1138    Args:
 1139        params: The parameters.
 1140        execution: The execution object for resolving input paths.
 1141    Returns:
 1142        Command-line arguments.
 1143    """
 1144    cargs = []
 1145    cargs.extend([
 1146        "-align-landmarks",
 1147        params.get("align_landmarks")
 1148    ])
 1149    return cargs
 1150
 1151
 1152def c3d_anisotropic_diffusion_params(
 1153    anisotropic_diffusion: str,
 1154) -> C3dAnisotropicDiffusionParameters:
 1155    """
 1156    Build parameters.
 1157    
 1158    Args:
 1159        anisotropic_diffusion: -add: Voxelwise image addition\
 1160            \
 1161            Syntax: `-add`\
 1162            \
 1163            Adds the last two images on the stack, and places the sum at the\
 1164            end of the stack.\
 1165            \
 1166            # Add two images: x = a + b\
 1167            c3d a.img b.img -add -o x.img\
 1168            \
 1169            # Add three images, x = (a + b) + c in the first example, x = a +\
 1170            (b + c) in the second\
 1171            c3d a.img b.img -add c.img -add -o x.img\
 1172            c3d a.img b.img c.img -add -add -o x.img\
 1173            \
 1174            # Subtract two images, using -scale command: x = a - b\
 1175            c3d a.img b.img -scale -1 -add -o x.img.
 1176    Returns:
 1177        Parameter dictionary
 1178    """
 1179    params = {
 1180        "__STYXTYPE__": "anisotropic_diffusion",
 1181        "anisotropic_diffusion": anisotropic_diffusion,
 1182    }
 1183    return params
 1184
 1185
 1186def c3d_anisotropic_diffusion_cargs(
 1187    params: C3dAnisotropicDiffusionParameters,
 1188    execution: Execution,
 1189) -> list[str]:
 1190    """
 1191    Build command-line arguments from parameters.
 1192    
 1193    Args:
 1194        params: The parameters.
 1195        execution: The execution object for resolving input paths.
 1196    Returns:
 1197        Command-line arguments.
 1198    """
 1199    cargs = []
 1200    cargs.extend([
 1201        "-anisotropic-diffusion",
 1202        params.get("anisotropic_diffusion")
 1203    ])
 1204    return cargs
 1205

 1245
 1246def c3d_set_params(
 1247    set_: str,
 1248) -> C3dSetParameters:
 1249    """
 1250    Build parameters.
 1251    
 1252    Args:
 1253        set_: -as: Assign image at the end of the stack to a variable\
 1254            \
 1255            Syntax: `-as var`\
 1256            \
 1257            Associates the image currently at the end of the stack with\
 1258            variable name 'var'. This allows you to retrieve the image later on\
 1259            the command line using the **-push** command. The **-as** and\
 1260            **-push** commands are useful when you need to use a certain image\
 1261            more than once during a convert3d operation. For example, if you\
 1262            want to compute the distance transform of a binary image and mask\
 1263            it so that the values outside of the binary image region have value\
 1264            0, you would use the following command:\
 1265            \
 1266            c3d binary.img -as A -sdt -push A -times -o masked_distance.img.
 1267    Returns:
 1268        Parameter dictionary
 1269    """
 1270    params = {
 1271        "__STYXTYPE__": "set",
 1272        "set": set_,
 1273    }
 1274    return params
 1275
 1276
 1277def c3d_set_cargs(
 1278    params: C3dSetParameters,
 1279    execution: Execution,
 1280) -> list[str]:
 1281    """
 1282    Build command-line arguments from parameters.
 1283    
 1284    Args:
 1285        params: The parameters.
 1286        execution: The execution object for resolving input paths.
 1287    Returns:
 1288        Command-line arguments.
 1289    """
 1290    cargs = []
 1291    cargs.extend([
 1292        "-as",
 1293        params.get("set")
 1294    ])
 1295    return cargs
 1296

 1337def c3d_atan2_params(
 1338    atan2: str,
 1339) -> C3dAtan2Parameters:
 1340    """
 1341    Build parameters.
 1342    
 1343    Args:
 1344        atan2: -atan2: Voxelwise angle from sine and cosine\
 1345            \
 1346            Syntax: `-atan2`\
 1347            \
 1348            Computes the angle in radians from images containing sine and\
 1349            cosine. This is a voxel-wise operation. It requires two images on\
 1350            the stack (sine followed by cosine):\
 1351            \
 1352            c3d sin_theta.nii.gz cos_theta.nii.gz -atan2 -o theta.nii.gz.
 1353    Returns:
 1354        Parameter dictionary
 1355    """
 1356    params = {
 1357        "__STYXTYPE__": "atan2",
 1358        "atan2": atan2,
 1359    }
 1360    return params

 1429def c3d_n4_bias_correction_params(

 1432    """
 1433    Build parameters.
 1434    
 1435    Args:
 1436        n4_bias_correction: -biascorr: Automatic MRI bias field correction\
 1437            \
 1438            Syntax: `-biascorr`\
 1439            \
 1440            Performs automatic bias field correction for MRI images. This\
 1441            feature uses the [N3 implementation in ITK by Dr. Tustison][4],\
 1442            based on the N3 algorithm by Sled et al.\
 1443            \
 1444            c3d mri.nii.gz -biascorr -o mricorr.nii.gz.
 1445    Returns:
 1446        Parameter dictionary
 1447    """
 1448    params = {
 1449        "__STYXTYPE__": "n4_bias_correction",
 1450        "n4_bias_correction": n4_bias_correction,
 1451    }
 1452    return params

 1475
 1476def c3d_binarize_params(
 1477    binarize: str,
 1478) -> C3dBinarizeParameters:
 1479    """
 1480    Build parameters.
 1481    
 1482    Args:
 1483        binarize: -binarize: Convert image to binary\
 1484            \
 1485            Syntax: `-binarize`\
 1486            \
 1487            Converts an image to binary by mapping all background values (the\
 1488            background is 0 by default and can be changed by the option\
 1489            **-background**) to 0 and all non-background values to 1. The\
 1490            **-binarize** command is shorthand for the **-threshold** command.\
 1491            \
 1492            c3d test.img -binarize -o binary.img\
 1493            c3d -background 10 -binarize -o binary.img\
 1494            c3d test.img -threshold 10 10 0 1 // equivalent to above command.
 1495    Returns:
 1496        Parameter dictionary
 1497    """
 1498    params = {
 1499        "__STYXTYPE__": "binarize",
 1500        "binarize": binarize,
 1501    }
 1502    return params
 1503
 1504
 1505def c3d_binarize_cargs(
 1506    params: C3dBinarizeParameters,
 1507    execution: Execution,
 1508) -> list[str]:
 1509    """
 1510    Build command-line arguments from parameters.
 1511    
 1512    Args:
 1513        params: The parameters.
 1514        execution: The execution object for resolving input paths.
 1515    Returns:
 1516        Command-line arguments.
 1517    """
 1518    cargs = []
 1519    cargs.extend([
 1520        "-binarize",
 1521        params.get("binarize")
 1522    ])
 1523    return cargs

 1529    """
 1530    Build parameters.
 1531    
 1532    Args:
 1533        canny: -canny: Canny edge detector\
 1534            \
 1535            Syntax: `-canny <sigma_vector> <t_lower> <t_upper>`\
 1536            \
 1537            Performs edge detection on the last image on the stack using the\
 1538            Canny filter. The parameters are a vector of standard deviations\
 1539            defining the scale of the edges detected and lower and upper\
 1540            thresholds for edge selection. See documentation on the [ITK Canny\
 1541            Filter][14].
 1542    Returns:
 1543        Parameter dictionary
 1544    """
 1545    params = {
 1546        "__STYXTYPE__": "canny",
 1547        "canny": canny,
 1548    }
 1549    return params

 1619def c3d_centroid_params(
 1620    centroid: str,
 1621) -> C3dCentroidParameters:
 1622    """
 1623    Build parameters.
 1624    
 1625    Args:
 1626        centroid: -centroid: Report centroid of foreground voxels\
 1627            \
 1628            Syntax: `-centroid`\
 1629            \
 1630            Reports the centroid, in physical coordinates, of all foreground\
 1631            voxels in the image.\
 1632            \
 1633            c3d binaryimage.img -centroid // centroid of all non-0 voxels\
 1634            c3d grayimage.img -thresh 1000 7000 1 0 -centroid 1 // centroid of\
 1635            all voxels in range 1000-7000\
 1636            c3d labelimage.img -thresh 5 5 1 0 -centroid // centroid of all\
 1637            voxels with label 5\
 1638            c3d labelimage.img -split -foreach -centroid -endfor // centroids\
 1639            of all labels (including 0).
 1640    Returns:
 1641        Parameter dictionary
 1642    """
 1643    params = {
 1644        "__STYXTYPE__": "centroid",
 1645        "centroid": centroid,
 1646    }
 1647    return params
 1648
 1649

 1651    params: C3dCentroidParameters,

 1657    Args:
 1658        params: The parameters.

 1660    Returns:
 1661        Command-line arguments.
 1662    """

 1664    cargs.extend([
 1665        "-centroid",
 1666        params.get("centroid")
 1667    ])
 1668    return cargs
 1669
 1670
 1671def c3d_centroid_mark_params(
 1672    centroid_mark: str,
 1673) -> C3dCentroidMarkParameters:
 1674    """
 1675    Build parameters.
 1676    
 1677    Args:
 1678        centroid_mark: -centroid-mark: Mark the centroid of foreground voxels\
 1679            \
 1680            Syntax: `-centroid-mark <label>`\
 1681            \
 1682            Marks the centroid of the foreground voxels in an image. Unlike\
 1683            **-centroid**, this command does not print the centroid location,\
 1684            but marks the closest voxel in the image with the intensity\
 1685            **label**. The remaining voxels are assigned 0 intensity. Combined\
 1686            with -dilate, this can be used to mark centers of regions with\
 1687            spheres.\
 1688            \
 1689            c3d binaryimage.nii -centroid-mark -dilate 1 3x3x3\
 1690            c3d labelimage.nii -split -foreach -centroid-mark -endfor -merge -o\
 1691            centers.nii.
 1692    Returns:
 1693        Parameter dictionary
 1694    """
 1695    params = {
 1696        "__STYXTYPE__": "centroid_mark",
 1697        "centroid_mark": centroid_mark,
 1698    }
 1699    return params
 1700
 1701
 1702def c3d_centroid_mark_cargs(
 1703    params: C3dCentroidMarkParameters,
 1704    execution: Execution,
 1705) -> list[str]:
 1706    """
 1707    Build command-line arguments from parameters.
 1708    
 1709    Args:
 1710        params: The parameters.
 1711        execution: The execution object for resolving input paths.
 1712    Returns:
 1713        Command-line arguments.
 1714    """
 1715    cargs = []
 1716    cargs.extend([
 1717        "-centroid-mark",
 1718        params.get("centroid_mark")
 1719    ])
 1720    return cargs
 1721
 1722
 1723def c3d_connected_components_params(
 1724    connected_components: str,
 1725) -> C3dConnectedComponentsParameters:
 1726    """
 1727    Build parameters.
 1728    
 1729    Args:
 1730        connected_components: -comp, -connected-components: Compute connected\
 1731            components\
 1732            \
 1733            Syntax: `-comp`\
 1734            \
 1735            Computes the connected components of a binary image. Each connected\
 1736            component is assigned an integer index. Indices are ordered by the\
 1737            size of the component, so the component assigned index 1 is the\
 1738            largest. The background is assigned index 0. To select the largest\
 1739            connected component, combine the call to **-comp** with a call to\
 1740            **-threshold**.\
 1741            \
 1742            c3d binary.img -comp -o comp.img\
 1743            c3d binary.img -comp -threshold 1 1 1 0 -o largest_comp.img.
 1744    Returns:
 1745        Parameter dictionary
 1746    """
 1747    params = {
 1748        "__STYXTYPE__": "connected_components",
 1749        "connected_components": connected_components,
 1750    }
 1751    return params
 1752
 1753
 1754def c3d_connected_components_cargs(
 1755    params: C3dConnectedComponentsParameters,
 1756    execution: Execution,
 1757) -> list[str]:
 1758    """
 1759    Build command-line arguments from parameters.
 1760    
 1761    Args:
 1762        params: The parameters.
 1763        execution: The execution object for resolving input paths.
 1764    Returns:
 1765        Command-line arguments.
 1766    """
 1767    cargs = []
 1768    cargs.extend([
 1769        "-connected-components",
 1770        params.get("connected_components")
 1771    ])
 1772    return cargs
 1773

 1785            \
 1786            Clears the image stack. Images assigned a name with the **-as**\
 1787            command will remain in memory.
 1788    Returns:
 1789        Parameter dictionary
 1790    """

 1792        "__STYXTYPE__": "clear",
 1793        "clear": clear_,
 1794    }
 1795    return params

 1801) -> list[str]:
 1802    """

 1812    cargs.extend([
 1813        "-clear",
 1814        params.get("clear")
 1815    ])
 1816    return cargs
 1817
 1818
 1819def c3d_clip_params(
 1820    clip: str,
 1821) -> C3dClipParameters:
 1822    """
 1823    Build parameters.
 1824    
 1825    Args:
 1826        clip: -clip: Clip image intensity to range\
 1827            \
 1828            Syntax: `-clip iMin iMax`\
 1829            \
 1830            Clips image intensities, so that the values below *iMin* are\
 1831            converted to *iMin* and values greater than *iMax* are converted to\
 1832            *iMax*. This is useful for eliminating hyperintensities in images.\
 1833            Values *iMin* and *iMax* are intensity specifications (see below).\
 1834            \
 1835            c3d mri.img -clip 1000 8000 -o mriclip01.img // Clips below and\
 1836            above\
 1837            c3d mri.img -clip -inf 8000 -o mriclip02.img // Clips above only\
 1838            c3d mri.img -clip -inf 95% -o mriclip03.img // Clips at 95th\
 1839            percentile.
 1840    Returns:
 1841        Parameter dictionary
 1842    """
 1843    params = {
 1844        "__STYXTYPE__": "clip",
 1845        "clip": clip,
 1846    }
 1847    return params
 1848
 1849
 1850def c3d_clip_cargs(
 1851    params: C3dClipParameters,
 1852    execution: Execution,
 1853) -> list[str]:
 1854    """
 1855    Build command-line arguments from parameters.
 1856    
 1857    Args:
 1858        params: The parameters.
 1859        execution: The execution object for resolving input paths.
 1860    Returns:
 1861        Command-line arguments.
 1862    """
 1863    cargs = []
 1864    cargs.extend([
 1865        "-clip",
 1866        params.get("clip")
 1867    ])
 1868    return cargs
 1869
 1870
 1871def c3d_color_map_params(
 1872    color_map: str,
 1873) -> C3dColorMapParameters:
 1874    """
 1875    Build parameters.
 1876    
 1877    Args:
 1878        color_map: -color-map, -colormap: Convert scalar image to RGB using\
 1879            color map\
 1880            \
 1881            Syntax: `-color-map <ColormapName> [min max]`\
 1882            \
 1883            Converts a scalar image to a color (RGB) image using a specified\
 1884            color map. The output of the command are three images, containing\
 1885            the red, green and blue channels of the RGB image. The mapping uses\
 1886            the range of the input image, e.g., using the **jet** color map,\
 1887            the lowest intensity pixel in the image will be mapped to blue, and\
 1888            the highest intesnity pixel will be mapped to red. The admissible\
 1889            color maps are\
 1890            **hot,cool,spring,summer,autumn,winter,copper,jet,hsv,red,green,blue,grey,overunder**.\
 1891            The command can be used with the -omc command to write RGB images.\
 1892            The example below generates a PNG image from a slice in a scalar\
 1893            image.\
 1894            \
 1895            c3d scalar.nii.gz -slice z 50% -flip y -color-map jet -type uchar\
 1896            -omc colorslice.png\
 1897            \
 1898            By default the full image intensity range is mapped. The optional\
 1899            **min** and **max** parameters can be used to set the range of the\
 1900            color map.\
 1901            \
 1902            c3d scalar.nii.gz -slice z 50% -flip y -color-map jet 0 1 -type\
 1903            uchar -omc colorslice.png.
 1904    Returns:
 1905        Parameter dictionary
 1906    """
 1907    params = {
 1908        "__STYXTYPE__": "color_map",
 1909        "color_map": color_map,
 1910    }
 1911    return params
 1912
 1913
 1914def c3d_color_map_cargs(
 1915    params: C3dColorMapParameters,
 1916    execution: Execution,
 1917) -> list[str]:
 1918    """
 1919    Build command-line arguments from parameters.
 1920    
 1921    Args:
 1922        params: The parameters.
 1923        execution: The execution object for resolving input paths.
 1924    Returns:
 1925        Command-line arguments.
 1926    """
 1927    cargs = []
 1928    cargs.extend([
 1929        "-colormap",
 1930        params.get("color_map")
 1931    ])
 1932    return cargs
 1933
 1934
 1935def c3d_compress_params(
 1936    compress: str,
 1937) -> C3dCompressParameters:
 1938    """
 1939    Build parameters.
 1940    
 1941    Args:
 1942        compress: -compress, -no-compress: Enable/disable compression for some\
 1943            image files\
 1944            \
 1945            Syntax: `-compress` or `-no-compress`\
 1946            \
 1947            Turns on compressing for image file formats that support it. For\
 1948            some file formats, like NIFTI (.nii), compression is enabled\
 1949            automatically when the filename includes the **.gz** extension. For\
 1950            other formats, like MetaImage, you need to specify **-compress** to\
 1951            enable compression. The following two commands save the image as\
 1952            compressed NIFTI and MetaImage files:\
 1953            \
 1954            c3d input.nii -o output.nii.gz\
 1955            c3d input.nii -compress -o output.mha.
 1956    Returns:
 1957        Parameter dictionary
 1958    """
 1959    params = {
 1960        "__STYXTYPE__": "compress",
 1961        "compress": compress,
 1962    }
 1963    return params
 1964
 1965
 1966def c3d_compress_cargs(
 1967    params: C3dCompressParameters,
 1968    execution: Execution,
 1969) -> list[str]:
 1970    """
 1971    Build command-line arguments from parameters.
 1972    
 1973    Args:
 1974        params: The parameters.
 1975        execution: The execution object for resolving input paths.
 1976    Returns:
 1977        Command-line arguments.
 1978    """
 1979    cargs = []
 1980    cargs.extend([
 1981        "-compress",
 1982        params.get("compress")
 1983    ])
 1984    return cargs
 1985
 1986
 1987def c3d_no_compress_params(
 1988    no_compress: str,
 1989) -> C3dNoCompressParameters:
 1990    """
 1991    Build parameters.
 1992    
 1993    Args:
 1994        no_compress: -compress, -no-compress: Enable/disable compression for\
 1995            some image files\
 1996            \
 1997            Syntax: `-compress` or `-no-compress`\
 1998            \
 1999            Turns on compressing for image file formats that support it. For\
 2000            some file formats, like NIFTI (.nii), compression is enabled\
 2001            automatically when the filename includes the **.gz** extension. For\
 2002            other formats, like MetaImage, you need to specify **-compress** to\
 2003            enable compression. The following two commands save the image as\
 2004            compressed NIFTI and MetaImage files:\
 2005            \
 2006            c3d input.nii -o output.nii.gz\
 2007            c3d input.nii -compress -o output.mha.
 2008    Returns:
 2009        Parameter dictionary
 2010    """
 2011    params = {
 2012        "__STYXTYPE__": "no_compress",
 2013        "no_compress": no_compress,
 2014    }
 2015    return params
 2016
 2017
 2018def c3d_no_compress_cargs(
 2019    params: C3dNoCompressParameters,
 2020    execution: Execution,
 2021) -> list[str]:
 2022    """
 2023    Build command-line arguments from parameters.
 2024    
 2025    Args:
 2026        params: The parameters.
 2027        execution: The execution object for resolving input paths.
 2028    Returns:
 2029        Command-line arguments.
 2030    """
 2031    cargs = []
 2032    cargs.extend([
 2033        "-no-compress",
 2034        params.get("no_compress")
 2035    ])
 2036    return cargs
 2037
 2038
 2039def c3d_conv_params(
 2040    conv: str,
 2041) -> C3dConvParameters:
 2042    """
 2043    Build parameters.
 2044    
 2045    Args:
 2046        conv: -conv: Convolution\
 2047            \
 2048            Syntax `-conv`\
 2049            \
 2050            Performs convolution between the last two images on the stack. The\
 2051            convolution is performed using the Fourier transform. The result is\
 2052            an image of the same dimensions as the first image. For more\
 2053            details, see ["FFT Based Convolution" by Gaetan Lehmann][Lehmann].\
 2054            \
 2055            c3d image.nii kernel.nii -conv -o result.nii\
 2056            \
 2057            \
 2058            [Lehmann]: https://hdl.handle.net/10380/3154.
 2059    Returns:
 2060        Parameter dictionary
 2061    """
 2062    params = {
 2063        "__STYXTYPE__": "conv",
 2064        "conv": conv,
 2065    }
 2066    return params
 2067
 2068
 2069def c3d_conv_cargs(
 2070    params: C3dConvParameters,
 2071    execution: Execution,
 2072) -> list[str]:
 2073    """
 2074    Build command-line arguments from parameters.
 2075    
 2076    Args:
 2077        params: The parameters.
 2078        execution: The execution object for resolving input paths.
 2079    Returns:
 2080        Command-line arguments.
 2081    """
 2082    cargs = []
 2083    cargs.extend([
 2084        "-conv",
 2085        params.get("conv")
 2086    ])
 2087    return cargs
 2088
 2089
 2090def c3d_coordinate_map_voxel_params(
 2091    coordinate_map_voxel: str,
 2092) -> C3dCoordinateMapVoxelParameters:
 2093    """
 2094    Build parameters.
 2095    
 2096    Args:
 2097        coordinate_map_voxel: -cmv, -coordinate-map-voxel: Generate voxel\
 2098            coordinate maps (voxel units)\
 2099            \
 2100            Syntax: `-cmv`\
 2101            \
 2102            For a *N*-dimensional image, replaces the last image on the stack\
 2103            with *N* images. The *k*-th output image at each voxel contains the\
 2104            $k$-th coordinate of that voxel, in voxel units.\
 2105            \
 2106            c3d image.nii -cmv -oo coordmap%d.nii.gz\
 2107            \
 2108            One can use this command to split a brain segmentation image into a\
 2109            left hemisphere segmentation and a right hemisphere segmentation\
 2110            (assuming the X coordinate corresponds to the right-left axis)\
 2111            \
 2112            c3d seg.nii -as SEG -cmv -pop -pop -thresh 50% inf 1 0 -as MASK \\\
 2113            -push SEG -times -o seg_left.nii.gz \\\
 2114            -push MASK -replace 1 0 0 1 \\\
 2115            -push SEG -times -o seg_right.nii.gz.
 2116    Returns:
 2117        Parameter dictionary
 2118    """
 2119    params = {
 2120        "__STYXTYPE__": "coordinate_map_voxel",
 2121        "coordinate_map_voxel": coordinate_map_voxel,
 2122    }
 2123    return params
 2124
 2125
 2126def c3d_coordinate_map_voxel_cargs(
 2127    params: C3dCoordinateMapVoxelParameters,
 2128    execution: Execution,
 2129) -> list[str]:
 2130    """
 2131    Build command-line arguments from parameters.
 2132    
 2133    Args:
 2134        params: The parameters.
 2135        execution: The execution object for resolving input paths.
 2136    Returns:
 2137        Command-line arguments.
 2138    """
 2139    cargs = []
 2140    cargs.extend([
 2141        "-coordinate-map-voxel",
 2142        params.get("coordinate_map_voxel")
 2143    ])
 2144    return cargs
 2145

 2147def c3d_coordinate_map_physical_params(
 2148    coordinate_map_physical: str,
 2149) -> C3dCoordinateMapPhysicalParameters:
 2150    """
 2151    Build parameters.
 2152    
 2153    Args:
 2154        coordinate_map_physical: -cmp, -coordinate-map-physical: Generate voxel\
 2155            coordinate maps (voxel units)\
 2156            \
 2157            Syntax: `-cmp`\
 2158            \
 2159            This command is similar to **-cmv** (**-coordinate-map-voxel**),\
 2160            but the output will contain the physical coordinates of the voxels,\
 2161            in the NIFTI (RAS) coordinate frame.
 2162    Returns:
 2163        Parameter dictionary
 2164    """
 2165    params = {
 2166        "__STYXTYPE__": "coordinate_map_physical",
 2167        "coordinate_map_physical": coordinate_map_physical,
 2168    }
 2169    return params
 2170
 2171

 2178    
 2179    Args:
 2180        params: The parameters.

 2182    Returns:
 2183        Command-line arguments.
 2184    """
 2185    cargs = []
 2186    cargs.extend([
 2187        "-coordinate-map-physical",
 2188        params.get("coordinate_map_physical")
 2189    ])
 2190    return cargs
 2191
 2192
 2193def c3d_copy_transform_params(
 2194    copy_transform: str,
 2195) -> C3dCopyTransformParameters:
 2196    """
 2197    Build parameters.
 2198    
 2199    Args:
 2200        copy_transform: -copy-transform: Copy header information\
 2201            \
 2202            Syntax: `-copy-transform`\
 2203            \
 2204            Copies the image header, specifically the image to physical space\
 2205            transform (origin, spacing, direction cosines), from the first\
 2206            image (reference) to the second image (target). This is best done\
 2207            with NIFTI images, which store this information well. In the\
 2208            example below, *out.nii* will have the same header as *first.nii*\
 2209            and the same intensities as *second.nii*.\
 2210            \
 2211            c3d first.nii second.nii -copy-transform -o out.nii.
 2212    Returns:
 2213        Parameter dictionary
 2214    """
 2215    params = {
 2216        "__STYXTYPE__": "copy_transform",
 2217        "copy_transform": copy_transform,
 2218    }
 2219    return params
 2220
 2221
 2222def c3d_copy_transform_cargs(
 2223    params: C3dCopyTransformParameters,
 2224    execution: Execution,
 2225) -> list[str]:
 2226    """
 2227    Build command-line arguments from parameters.
 2228    
 2229    Args:
 2230        params: The parameters.
 2231        execution: The execution object for resolving input paths.
 2232    Returns:
 2233        Command-line arguments.
 2234    """
 2235    cargs = []
 2236    cargs.extend([
 2237        "-copy-transform",
 2238        params.get("copy_transform")
 2239    ])
 2240    return cargs

 2281
 2282def c3d_create_params(
 2283    create: str,
 2284) -> C3dCreateParameters:
 2285    """
 2286    Build parameters.
 2287    
 2288    Args:
 2289        create: -create: Generate blank image\
 2290            \
 2291            Syntax: `-create dimensions voxel_size`\
 2292            \
 2293            Creates a new blank image with specified dimensions and voxel size,\
 2294            and places it at the end of the stack. The image is set to the\
 2295            current background value, which is 0 by default but can be\
 2296            overwritten with the **-background** command. The origin of the\
 2297            image can be changed with the **-origin** command.\
 2298            \
 2299            c3d -create 256x256x160 1x1x1mm -o newimage.img\
 2300            c3d -background 128 -create 256x256x160 1x1x1mm -origin\
 2301            128x128x80mm -o newimage.img.
 2302    Returns:
 2303        Parameter dictionary
 2304    """
 2305    params = {
 2306        "__STYXTYPE__": "create",
 2307        "create": create,
 2308    }
 2309    return params
 2310
 2311
 2312def c3d_create_cargs(
 2313    params: C3dCreateParameters,
 2314    execution: Execution,
 2315) -> list[str]:
 2316    """
 2317    Build command-line arguments from parameters.
 2318    
 2319    Args:
 2320        params: The parameters.
 2321        execution: The execution object for resolving input paths.
 2322    Returns:
 2323        Command-line arguments.
 2324    """
 2325    cargs = []
 2326    cargs.extend([
 2327        "-create",
 2328        params.get("create")
 2329    ])
 2330    return cargs

 2378def c3d_dicom_series_read_params(
 2379    dicom_series_read: str,
 2380) -> C3dDicomSeriesReadParameters:
 2381    """
 2382    Build parameters.
 2383    
 2384    Args:
 2385        dicom_series_read: -dicom-series-read: Read a DICOM image series\
 2386            \
 2387            Syntax: `-dicom-series-read <directory> <series_id>`\
 2388            \
 2389            Imports a specific DICOM image series from a directory containing\
 2390            DICOM files. The **directory** parameter may also point to one of\
 2391            the DICOM files in the directory.\
 2392            The **seried_id** is a string identifier for the series that can be\
 2393            obtained by calling **-dicom-series-list**.
 2394    Returns:
 2395        Parameter dictionary
 2396    """
 2397    params = {
 2398        "__STYXTYPE__": "dicom_series_read",
 2399        "dicom_series_read": dicom_series_read,
 2400    }
 2401    return params

 2425def c3d_dilate_params(
 2426    dilate: str,
 2427) -> C3dDilateParameters:
 2428    """
 2429    Build parameters.
 2430    
 2431    Args:
 2432        dilate: -dilate: Binary dilation\
 2433            \
 2434            Syntax: `-dilate <label> <radius_vector>`\
 2435            \
 2436            Applies the dilation [mathematical morphology][5] operation to a\
 2437            binary image. The first parameter is the intensity value of the\
 2438            object that is to be dilated. The second is the radius of the\
 2439            dilation structuring element in 3D.\
 2440            \
 2441            c3d binary.img -dilate 255 3x3x3vox -o newimage.img.
 2442    Returns:
 2443        Parameter dictionary
 2444    """
 2445    params = {
 2446        "__STYXTYPE__": "dilate",
 2447        "dilate": dilate,
 2448    }
 2449    return params
 2450

 2472
 2473def c3d_divide_params(
 2474    divide: str,
 2475) -> C3dDivideParameters:
 2476    """
 2477    Build parameters.
 2478    
 2479    Args:
 2480        divide: -divide: Voxelwise image division\
 2481            \
 2482            Syntax: `-divide`\
 2483            \
 2484            Divides one image by another. For instance to compute C = A / B,\
 2485            use the command\
 2486            \
 2487            c3d A.img B.img -divide -o C.img\
 2488            \
 2489            Divison may generate infinite and not-a-number (NaN) values if B\
 2490            contains zeros. You can use **-replace** to get rid of these values\
 2491            \
 2492            c3d A.img B.img -divide -replace inf 1000 -inf -1000 NaN 0 -o\
 2493            C2.img.
 2494    Returns:
 2495        Parameter dictionary
 2496    """
 2497    params = {
 2498        "__STYXTYPE__": "divide",
 2499        "divide": divide,
 2500    }
 2501    return params
 2502
 2503

 2515        Command-line arguments.
 2516    """

 2518    cargs.extend([
 2519        "-divide",
 2520        params.get("divide")
 2521    ])

 2524
 2525def c3d_duplicate_params(
 2526    duplicate: str,
 2527) -> C3dDuplicateParameters:
 2528    """
 2529    Build parameters.
 2530    
 2531    Args:
 2532        duplicate: -dup: Duplicate the last image on the stack\
 2533            \
 2534            Syntax: `-dup`\
 2535            \
 2536            Duplicates the image at the end of the stack. This is equivalent to\
 2537            **-as var -push var**, but shorter. An example is when you want to\
 2538            pass an image as both arguments to a binary operator, e.g.,\
 2539            computing the square of the image intensity:\
 2540            \
 2541            c3d input.img -dup -times -o square.img\
 2542            \
 2543            ### Commands: Voxelwise Calculations.
 2544    Returns:
 2545        Parameter dictionary
 2546    """
 2547    params = {
 2548        "__STYXTYPE__": "duplicate",
 2549        "duplicate": duplicate,
 2550    }
 2551    return params
 2552
 2553
 2554def c3d_duplicate_cargs(
 2555    params: C3dDuplicateParameters,
 2556    execution: Execution,
 2557) -> list[str]:
 2558    """
 2559    Build command-line arguments from parameters.
 2560    
 2561    Args:
 2562        params: The parameters.
 2563        execution: The execution object for resolving input paths.
 2564    Returns:
 2565        Command-line arguments.
 2566    """
 2567    cargs = []
 2568    cargs.extend([
 2569        "-dup",
 2570        params.get("duplicate")
 2571    ])
 2572    return cargs
 2573
 2574
 2575def c3d_endaccum_params(
 2576    endaccum: str,
 2577) -> C3dEndaccumParameters:
 2578    """
 2579    Build parameters.
 2580    
 2581    Args:
 2582        endaccum: -accum, -endaccum: Accumulate operations over all images\
 2583            \
 2584            Syntax: `-accum command-list -endaccum`\
 2585            \
 2586            Apply a binary operation (such as addition or multiplication) to\
 2587            all the images on the stack in a cumulative fashion. The command(s)\
 2588            will be applied to the last and second-to-last images on the stack,\
 2589            then to the result of this operation and the third-to-last image on\
 2590            the stack and so on. Below is the example of using the command to\
 2591            add multiple images.\
 2592            \
 2593            c3d image*.nii -accum -add -endaccum -o sum.nii.
 2594    Returns:
 2595        Parameter dictionary
 2596    """
 2597    params = {
 2598        "__STYXTYPE__": "endaccum",
 2599        "endaccum": endaccum,
 2600    }
 2601    return params
 2602
 2603
 2604def c3d_endaccum_cargs(
 2605    params: C3dEndaccumParameters,
 2606    execution: Execution,
 2607) -> list[str]:
 2608    """
 2609    Build command-line arguments from parameters.
 2610    
 2611    Args:
 2612        params: The parameters.
 2613        execution: The execution object for resolving input paths.
 2614    Returns:
 2615        Command-line arguments.
 2616    """
 2617    cargs = []
 2618    cargs.extend([
 2619        "-endaccum",
 2620        params.get("endaccum")
 2621    ])
 2622    return cargs
 2623
 2624
 2625def c3d_endfor_params(
 2626    endfor: str,
 2627) -> C3dEndforParameters:
 2628    """
 2629    Build parameters.
 2630    
 2631    Args:
 2632        endfor: -foreach, -endfor: Loop commands over all images on the stack\
 2633            \
 2634            Syntax: `-foreach commands-list -endfor`\
 2635            \
 2636            This command forces the commands between **-foreach** and\
 2637            **-endfor** to be applied to every image on the stack. The main use\
 2638            of this command is to automate processing of multiple datasets. For\
 2639            example,\
 2640            \
 2641            c3d epi*.nii -foreach -smooth 3mm -endfor -oo epism%03d.nii.
 2642    Returns:
 2643        Parameter dictionary
 2644    """
 2645    params = {
 2646        "__STYXTYPE__": "endfor",
 2647        "endfor": endfor,
 2648    }
 2649    return params
 2650
 2651
 2652def c3d_endfor_cargs(
 2653    params: C3dEndforParameters,
 2654    execution: Execution,
 2655) -> list[str]:
 2656    """
 2657    Build command-line arguments from parameters.
 2658    
 2659    Args:
 2660        params: The parameters.
 2661        execution: The execution object for resolving input paths.
 2662    Returns:
 2663        Command-line arguments.
 2664    """
 2665    cargs = []
 2666    cargs.extend([
 2667        "-endfor",
 2668        params.get("endfor")
 2669    ])
 2670    return cargs
 2671
 2672
 2673def c3d_erode_params(
 2674    erode: str,
 2675) -> C3dErodeParameters:
 2676    """
 2677    Build parameters.
 2678    
 2679    Args:
 2680        erode: -erode: Binary erosion\
 2681            \
 2682            Syntax: `-erode <label> <radius_vector>`\
 2683            \
 2684            Applies erosion [mathematical morphology][5] operation to a binary\
 2685            image. The first parameter is the intensity value of the object\
 2686            that is to be eroded. The second is the radius of the erosion\
 2687            structuring element in 3D.\
 2688            \
 2689            c3d binary.img -erode 255 3x3x3vox -o newimage.img.
 2690    Returns:
 2691        Parameter dictionary
 2692    """
 2693    params = {
 2694        "__STYXTYPE__": "erode",
 2695        "erode": erode,
 2696    }
 2697    return params
 2698

 2721def c3d_erf_params(
 2722    erf: str,
 2723) -> C3dErfParameters:
 2724    """
 2725    Build parameters.
 2726    
 2727    Args:
 2728        erf: -erf: Standard error function\
 2729            \
 2730            Syntax: `-erf mu sigma`\
 2731            \
 2732            Computes the standard error function. This is useful for applying\
 2733            soft thresholds. The function computes y = erf((x - mu)/sigma).\
 2734            \
 2735            c3d input.img -erf 5 2 -o erf.img.
 2736    Returns:
 2737        Parameter dictionary
 2738    """
 2739    params = {
 2740        "__STYXTYPE__": "erf",
 2741        "erf": erf,
 2742    }
 2743    return params

 2810
 2811
 2812def c3d_export_patches_params(
 2813    export_patches: str,
 2814) -> C3dExportPatchesParameters:
 2815    """
 2816    Build parameters.
 2817    
 2818    Args:
 2819        export_patches: -export-patches, -xp: Fixed size patch sampling from\
 2820            masked regions\
 2821            \
 2822            Syntax: `-export-patches <outfile> <radius_vector> <frequency>`\
 2823            \
 2824            See also: **-export-patches-aug (-xpa)** command, which provides\
 2825            data augmentation for deep learning.\
 2826            \
 2827            This command samples patches from a region of a ND image and stores\
 2828            them into a data file that can be read easily in other software,\
 2829            for example, NumPy. This is useful for generating training data for\
 2830            machine learning projects. Multiple "channels" can be sampled.\
 2831            \
 2832            c3d chan1.nii chan2.nii chan3.nii mask.nii -xp samples.dat 4x4x4\
 2833            100\
 2834            \
 2835            This command will sample the three images chan1, chan2, chan3 at\
 2836            foreground voxels in the mask. Voxels in the mask foreground region\
 2837            are sampled randomly, following a uniform distribution. The value\
 2838            of 100 means that every 100-th voxel, on average, is sampled. The\
 2839            radius 4x4x4 means that patches of size 9x9x9 will be generated.\
 2840            For each sampled voxel, the sampled intensity data is represented\
 2841            as a 3x9x9x9 array in this example.\
 2842            \
 2843            To read these samples in NumPy use the following code\
 2844            \
 2845            dims = (9,9,9) # Patch dimensions\
 2846            k = 3 # Number of channels\
 2847            bps = (4 * k * reduce(mul, dims, 1)) # Bytes per sample\
 2848            np = os.path.getsize(fname) // bps # Number of samples\
 2849            arr = numpy.memmap(fname,'float32','r',shape=(np,k) + dims)\
 2850            \
 2851            It is also possible to visualize the extracted samples in ITK-SNAP\
 2852            by reading them as a raw image, with dimensions equal to the\
 2853            dimensions of the patch, and the z-dimension multiplied by the\
 2854            number of samples.\
 2855            \
 2856            The command can also be used to extract entire structures. For\
 2857            example, if we have a binary segmentation of a lesion of an\
 2858            approximately known size in an MRI scan, we can extract a patch of\
 2859            given size centered on this lesion, as follows:\
 2860            \
 2861            c3d mri.nii lesion_seg.nii -centroid-mark 1 -xp single_sample.dat\
 2862            50x50x20 1\
 2863            \
 2864            In the above example, **-centroid-mark** transforms the lesion\
 2865            segmentation into a single-voxel mask, from which the sample from\
 2866            the MRI is taken.
 2867    Returns:
 2868        Parameter dictionary
 2869    """
 2870    params = {
 2871        "__STYXTYPE__": "export_patches",
 2872        "export_patches": export_patches,
 2873    }
 2874    return params
 2875
 2876
 2877def c3d_export_patches_cargs(
 2878    params: C3dExportPatchesParameters,
 2879    execution: Execution,
 2880) -> list[str]:
 2881    """
 2882    Build command-line arguments from parameters.
 2883    
 2884    Args:
 2885        params: The parameters.
 2886        execution: The execution object for resolving input paths.
 2887    Returns:
 2888        Command-line arguments.
 2889    """
 2890    cargs = []
 2891    cargs.extend([
 2892        "-export-patches",
 2893        params.get("export_patches")
 2894    ])
 2895    return cargs
 2896
 2897
 2898def c3d_export_patches_aug_params(
 2899    export_patches_aug: str,
 2900) -> C3dExportPatchesAugParameters:
 2901    """
 2902    Build parameters.
 2903    
 2904    Args:
 2905        export_patches_aug: -export-patches-aug, -xpa: data augmentation for\
 2906            deep learning\
 2907            \
 2908            Syntax `-export-patches-aug <N> <sigma_angle>`\
 2909            \
 2910            This command must precede the `-export-patches (-xp)` command and\
 2911            instructs this command to not only sample patches along the image\
 2912            axes but to also sample **N** randomly rotated patches. Rotation is\
 2913            around a uniformly distributed axis with a rotation angle\
 2914            distributed normally with teh standard deviation **sigma_angle**,\
 2915            specified in degrees. This kind of sampling is useful for data\
 2916            augmentation for machine learning algorithms.\
 2917            \
 2918            c3d chan1.nii chan2.nii chan3.nii mask.nii -xpa 5 10 -xp\
 2919            samples.dat 4x4x4 100.
 2920    Returns:
 2921        Parameter dictionary
 2922    """
 2923    params = {
 2924        "__STYXTYPE__": "export_patches_aug",
 2925        "export_patches_aug": export_patches_aug,
 2926    }
 2927    return params
 2928
 2929
 2930def c3d_export_patches_aug_cargs(
 2931    params: C3dExportPatchesAugParameters,
 2932    execution: Execution,
 2933) -> list[str]:
 2934    """
 2935    Build command-line arguments from parameters.
 2936    
 2937    Args:
 2938        params: The parameters.
 2939        execution: The execution object for resolving input paths.
 2940    Returns:
 2941        Command-line arguments.
 2942    """
 2943    cargs = []
 2944    cargs.extend([
 2945        "-export-patches-aug",
 2946        params.get("export_patches_aug")
 2947    ])
 2948    return cargs
 2949

 3029def c3d_fft_params(
 3030    fft: str,
 3031) -> C3dFftParameters:
 3032    """
 3033    Build parameters.
 3034    
 3035    Args:
 3036        fft: -fft: Fast Fourier transform\
 3037            \
 3038            Syntax `-fft`\
 3039            \
 3040            Computes the Fourier transform of a real-valued image at the end of\
 3041            the stack. The image is replaced by the real and imaginary\
 3042            components of the FFT. This command is only available if\
 3043            **convert3d** is compiled with the FFTW library support.\
 3044            \
 3045            c3d image.nii -fft -oo real.nii imag.nii.
 3046    Returns:
 3047        Parameter dictionary
 3048    """
 3049    params = {
 3050        "__STYXTYPE__": "fft",
 3051        "fft": fft,
 3052    }
 3053    return params
 3054

 3087            \
 3088            Flips the image around specified axes. The parameter 'axes' may be\
 3089            any combination of characters 'x', 'y', and 'z'; the order does not\
 3090            matter.\
 3091            \
 3092            c3d input.img -flip xy -o output.img.
 3093    Returns:
 3094        Parameter dictionary
 3095    """
 3096    params = {
 3097        "__STYXTYPE__": "flip",
 3098        "flip": flip,
 3099    }

 3124def c3d_floor_params(
 3125    floor: str,
 3126) -> C3dFloorParameters:
 3127    """
 3128    Build parameters.
 3129    
 3130    Args:
 3131        floor: -floor: Round down image intensities\
 3132            \
 3133            Syntax: `-floor `\
 3134            \
 3135            Each image intensity is replaced by the largest integer smaller or\
 3136            equal to it.\
 3137            \
 3138            c3d input.img -floor -o output.img\
 3139            \
 3140            To round each intensity to the closest integer, use\
 3141            \
 3142            c3d input.img -shift 0.5 -floor.
 3143    Returns:
 3144        Parameter dictionary
 3145    """
 3146    params = {
 3147        "__STYXTYPE__": "floor",
 3148        "floor": floor,
 3149    }
 3150    return params
 3151

 3163    Returns:
 3164        Command-line arguments.

 3174def c3d_foreach_params(
 3175    foreach: str,
 3176) -> C3dForeachParameters:
 3177    """
 3178    Build parameters.
 3179    
 3180    Args:
 3181        foreach: -foreach, -endfor: Loop commands over all images on the stack\
 3182            \
 3183            Syntax: `-foreach commands-list -endfor`\
 3184            \
 3185            This command forces the commands between **-foreach** and\
 3186            **-endfor** to be applied to every image on the stack. The main use\
 3187            of this command is to automate processing of multiple datasets. For\
 3188            example,\
 3189            \
 3190            c3d epi*.nii -foreach -smooth 3mm -endfor -oo epism%03d.nii.
 3191    Returns:
 3192        Parameter dictionary
 3193    """
 3194    params = {
 3195        "__STYXTYPE__": "foreach",
 3196        "foreach": foreach,
 3197    }
 3198    return params
 3199

 3202    params: C3dForeachParameters,
 3203    execution: Execution,
 3204) -> list[str]:
 3205    """
 3206    Build command-line arguments from parameters.
 3207    
 3208    Args:
 3209        params: The parameters.
 3210        execution: The execution object for resolving input paths.
 3211    Returns:
 3212        Command-line arguments.
 3213    """
 3214    cargs = []
 3215    cargs.extend([
 3216        "-foreach",
 3217        params.get("foreach")
 3218    ])
 3219    return cargs
 3220
 3221
 3222def c3d_foreach_comp_params(
 3223    foreach_comp: str,
 3224) -> C3dForeachCompParameters:
 3225    """
 3226    Build parameters.
 3227    
 3228    Args:
 3229        foreach_comp: -foreach-comp, -endfor: Loop commands over components of\
 3230            a multi-component image\
 3231            \
 3232            Syntax `-foreach-comp <N> commands-list -endfor`\
 3233            \
 3234            This command runs the list of commands separately for each\
 3235            component of a set of multi-component images loaded with -mcs. This\
 3236            makes it possible to perform component-wise operations on\
 3237            multi-component images. For example, it can be used to average\
 3238            several multi-component images. If the image stack contains images\
 3239            *x1* *y1* *z1* *x2* *y2* *z2*, then the operations will be run on\
 3240            *[x1,x2]*, *[y1,y2]*, *[z1,z2]*. For example, if multi_1.nii to\
 3241            multi_10.nii are three-component images, then the mean\
 3242            three-component image is given by\
 3243            \
 3244            c2d -mcs multi_*.nii -foreach-comp -mean -endfor -omc\
 3245            multi_mean.nii.
 3246    Returns:
 3247        Parameter dictionary
 3248    """
 3249    params = {
 3250        "__STYXTYPE__": "foreach_comp",
 3251        "foreach_comp": foreach_comp,
 3252    }
 3253    return params
 3254
 3255
 3256def c3d_foreach_comp_cargs(
 3257    params: C3dForeachCompParameters,
 3258    execution: Execution,
 3259) -> list[str]:
 3260    """
 3261    Build command-line arguments from parameters.
 3262    
 3263    Args:
 3264        params: The parameters.
 3265        execution: The execution object for resolving input paths.
 3266    Returns:
 3267        Command-line arguments.
 3268    """
 3269    cargs = []
 3270    cargs.extend([
 3271        "-foreach-comp",
 3272        params.get("foreach_comp")
 3273    ])
 3274    return cargs
 3275
 3276
 3277def c3d_glm_params(
 3278    glm: str,
 3279) -> C3dGlmParameters:
 3280    """
 3281    Build parameters.
 3282    
 3283    Args:
 3284        glm: -glm: General linear model\
 3285            \
 3286            Syntax: `-glm design_matrix_file contrast_vector_file`\
 3287            \
 3288            Applies voxel-wise general linear model to a set of images. More\
 3289            precisely, the general linear model solves the following system: $Y\
 3290            = X \\beta + \\epsilon$, where Y are the observations (a list of n\
 3291            images, where each voxel is treated as an independent observation);\
 3292            X is the $n x k$ design matrix, where $k$ is the number of factors;\
 3293            $\\beta$ is a set of $k$ unknown images (factors) and $\\epsilon$\
 3294            is the error term. The command will compute the $\\beta$ images and\
 3295            return a weighted sum of them, where the weights are specified in\
 3296            the contrast vector. The design matrix and the contrast vector are\
 3297            passed in as files. The file format is just a space-separated list\
 3298            of numbers. For a good explanation of the general linear model, see\
 3299            [S. Kiebel and A. Holmes, General Linear Model, in Ashburner,\
 3300            Friston, Holmes eds., *Human Brain Function, 2nd Edition*][6]. The\
 3301            example below computes the regression coefficient between a set of\
 3302            longitudinal images and subject's age:\
 3303            \
 3304            echo "1 67.00" > design_mat.txt\
 3305            echo "1 75.00" >> design_mat.txt\
 3306            echo "1 80.00" >> design_mat.txt\
 3307            echo "1 83.00" >> design_mat.txt\
 3308            echo "0 1" >> contrast_vec.txt\
 3309            c3d time1.img time2.img time3.img time4.img -glm design_mat.txt\
 3310            contrast_vec.txt -o regress.img.
 3311    Returns:
 3312        Parameter dictionary
 3313    """
 3314    params = {
 3315        "__STYXTYPE__": "glm",
 3316        "glm": glm,
 3317    }
 3318    return params
 3319
 3320
 3321def c3d_glm_cargs(
 3322    params: C3dGlmParameters,
 3323    execution: Execution,
 3324) -> list[str]:
 3325    """
 3326    Build command-line arguments from parameters.
 3327    
 3328    Args:
 3329        params: The parameters.
 3330        execution: The execution object for resolving input paths.
 3331    Returns:
 3332        Command-line arguments.
 3333    """
 3334    cargs = []
 3335    cargs.extend([
 3336        "-glm",
 3337        params.get("glm")
 3338    ])
 3339    return cargs
 3340
 3341
 3342def c3d_gradient_params(
 3343    gradient: str,
 3344) -> C3dGradientParameters:
 3345    """
 3346    Build parameters.
 3347    
 3348    Args:
 3349        gradient: -grad, -gradient: Image gradient\
 3350            \
 3351            Syntax `-grad`\
 3352            \
 3353            Computes the gradient of the image. Each component of the gradient\
 3354            is placed on the stack in order (x,y,z). The gradient is computed\
 3355            in physical RAS coordinates, taking into account image spacing and\
 3356            orientation. In other words, the gradient is the vector in physical\
 3357            space orthogonal to the isocontours of the image. No smoothing is\
 3358            performed, so it is a good idea to smooth the image first before\
 3359            computing the gradient.\
 3360            \
 3361            c3d myimage.nii -smooth 1.2vox -grad -oo grad_comp_%02d.nii.
 3362    Returns:
 3363        Parameter dictionary
 3364    """
 3365    params = {
 3366        "__STYXTYPE__": "gradient",
 3367        "gradient": gradient,
 3368    }
 3369    return params
 3370
 3371
 3372def c3d_gradient_cargs(
 3373    params: C3dGradientParameters,
 3374    execution: Execution,
 3375) -> list[str]:
 3376    """
 3377    Build command-line arguments from parameters.
 3378    
 3379    Args:
 3380        params: The parameters.
 3381        execution: The execution object for resolving input paths.
 3382    Returns:
 3383        Command-line arguments.
 3384    """
 3385    cargs = []
 3386    cargs.extend([
 3387        "-grad",
 3388        params.get("gradient")
 3389    ])
 3390    return cargs
 3391
 3392
 3393def c3d__help_params(
 3394    v__help: str,
 3395) -> C3dHelpParameters:
 3396    """
 3397    Build parameters.
 3398    
 3399    Args:
 3400        v__help: -hesseig, -hessian-eigenvalues: Compute eigenvalues of the\
 3401            Hessian matrix\
 3402            \
 3403            Syntax `-hesseig <scale>`\
 3404            \
 3405            Computes the Hessian matrix at every pixel of an image and the\
 3406            eigenvalues of the Hessian. Images of the eigenvalues (sorted by\
 3407            value) are placed on the stack. These images are useful as texture\
 3408            features. See also the '''-steig''' command. The scale determines\
 3409            the amount of Gaussian smoothing applied for computing the partial\
 3410            derivatives in the Hessian, and is in physical (mm) units.\
 3411            \
 3412            c3d myimage.nii -hesseig 2.0 -oo eig%02d.nii.gz.
 3413    Returns:
 3414        Parameter dictionary
 3415    """
 3416    params = {
 3417        "__STYXTYPE__": "_help",
 3418        "_help": v__help,
 3419    }
 3420    return params
 3421
 3422
 3423def c3d__help_cargs(
 3424    params: C3dHelpParameters,
 3425    execution: Execution,
 3426) -> list[str]:
 3427    """
 3428    Build command-line arguments from parameters.
 3429    
 3430    Args:
 3431        params: The parameters.
 3432        execution: The execution object for resolving input paths.
 3433    Returns:
 3434        Command-line arguments.
 3435    """
 3436    cargs = []
 3437    cargs.extend([
 3438        "-h",
 3439        params.get("_help")
 3440    ])
 3441    return cargs
 3442
 3443
 3444def c3d_holefill_params(
 3445    holefill: str,
 3446) -> C3dHolefillParameters:
 3447    """
 3448    Build parameters.
 3449    
 3450    Args:
 3451        holefill: -holefill: Fill holes in binary image\
 3452            \
 3453            Syntax: `-holefill intensity_value [0|1] `\
 3454            \
 3455            Apply the binary hole filling algorithm to a particular intensity\
 3456            value in the image. The input image is typically a binary image or\
 3457            a multi-label segmentation image. Holes (voxels not matching the\
 3458            specified intensity value that are completely contained by voxels\
 3459            matching this value) are filled. The second parameter specifies\
 3460            what type of topological connectivity is used to determine holes.\
 3461            The value 0 uses the default algorithm in ITK (face connectivity)\
 3462            and 1 uses the full connectivity variant (face, edge and vertex\
 3463            connectivity). For more details see the [ITK page for this\
 3464            algorithm][7].\
 3465            \
 3466            c3d segmentation.nii.gz -holefill 5 0 -type uchar -o\
 3467            filledlabel5.nii.gz.
 3468    Returns:
 3469        Parameter dictionary
 3470    """
 3471    params = {
 3472        "__STYXTYPE__": "holefill",
 3473        "holefill": holefill,
 3474    }
 3475    return params
 3476
 3477
 3478def c3d_holefill_cargs(
 3479    params: C3dHolefillParameters,
 3480    execution: Execution,
 3481) -> list[str]:
 3482    """
 3483    Build command-line arguments from parameters.
 3484    
 3485    Args:
 3486        params: The parameters.
 3487        execution: The execution object for resolving input paths.
 3488    Returns:
 3489        Command-line arguments.
 3490    """
 3491    cargs = []
 3492    cargs.extend([
 3493        "-hf",
 3494        params.get("holefill")
 3495    ])
 3496    return cargs
 3497

 3499def c3d_hessian_eigenvalues_params(
 3500    hessian_eigenvalues: str,
 3501) -> C3dHessianEigenvaluesParameters:
 3502    """
 3503    Build parameters.
 3504    
 3505    Args:
 3506        hessian_eigenvalues: -hesseig, -hessian-eigenvalues: Compute\
 3507            eigenvalues of the Hessian matrix\
 3508            \
 3509            Syntax `-hesseig <scale>`\
 3510            \
 3511            Computes the Hessian matrix at every pixel of an image and the\
 3512            eigenvalues of the Hessian. Images of the eigenvalues (sorted by\
 3513            value) are placed on the stack. These images are useful as texture\
 3514            features. See also the '''-steig''' command. The scale determines\
 3515            the amount of Gaussian smoothing applied for computing the partial\
 3516            derivatives in the Hessian, and is in physical (mm) units.\
 3517            \
 3518            c3d myimage.nii -hesseig 2.0 -oo eig%02d.nii.gz.
 3519    Returns:
 3520        Parameter dictionary
 3521    """
 3522    params = {
 3523        "__STYXTYPE__": "hessian_eigenvalues",
 3524        "hessian_eigenvalues": hessian_eigenvalues,
 3525    }
 3526    return params
 3527
 3528
 3529def c3d_hessian_eigenvalues_cargs(
 3530    params: C3dHessianEigenvaluesParameters,
 3531    execution: Execution,
 3532) -> list[str]:
 3533    """
 3534    Build command-line arguments from parameters.
 3535    
 3536    Args:
 3537        params: The parameters.
 3538        execution: The execution object for resolving input paths.
 3539    Returns:
 3540        Command-line arguments.
 3541    """
 3542    cargs = []
 3543    cargs.extend([
 3544        "-hesseig",
 3545        params.get("hessian_eigenvalues")
 3546    ])
 3547    return cargs
